cli.description: Provides tools for managing mining devices running Braiins OS[+]

label.subcommands_description: Braiins OS tools in the toolbox

help.version: Show program's version number and exit
help.subcommands: Choose one of the tools and run with --help to retrieve additional info how to use it

install.description: Install Braiins OS[+] onto a mining machine

help.hosts: Hostname (IP address) or path to a file with a list of miners
help.open-source: Use for installation of the Open-Source version
help.nightly: Use for installation of the Nightly version
help.backup: Backup miner before the installation (NAND and configuration)
help.no-nand-backup: Skip full NAND backup (config is still being backed up)
help.pool-user: Set the username and workername for Slush Pool
help.no-keep-network: Do not keep miner network configuration (use DHCP)
help.no-keep-pools: Do not keep miner pool configuration
help.no-keep-hostname: Do not keep miner hostname and generate new one based on MAC
help.no-wait: Do not wait until system is fully upgraded and rebooted
help.dry-run: Do all upgrade steps without the actual upgrade
help.post-upgrade: Path to directory with stage3.sh script

uninstall.description: Uninstall Braiins OS[+] from the miner(s)

help.hosts: Hostname (IP address) or path to a file with a list of miners
help.backup_path: Path to a directory or tgz file with data for miner restore
help.nand-restore: Use full NAND restore from previous backup

update.description: Update system / system package on miners running Braiins OS[+]

help.hosts: Hostname (IP address) or path to a file with a list of miners
help.package: Package name for update (select 'firmware' for firmware update

config.description: Configure mining machines running Braiins OS[+]

help.action: Load, Save, Apply or Save & Apply
help.table: Path to table file in CSV format
help.check: Do all configuration steps without applying the configuration

command.description: Run commands on selected miners. Use start/stop/restart for miner control or arbitrary shell commands.

help.hosts: Hostname (IP address) or path to a file with a list of miners
help.command: Command to run ('start', 'stop', 'restart' or shell command)
help.auto: Use SSH if RPC is not available

unlock.description: Unlocks SSH access for Antminers S9

help.hosts: Hostname (IP address) or path to a file with a list of miners
help.upgrade_path: Custom path to upgrade file with payload for miner unlock
help.port: Port of antminer web interface to use for unlocking (default - 80)

scan.description: Actively scan provided range of address for mining machines (including machines running factory firmware)

help.hostname:
Subnet range or IP addresses used for scanning
Use 10.10.10.0/24 for 10.10.10.0 - 10.10.10.255 range
Use 10.10.0.0/16 for 10.10.0.0 - 10.10.255.255 range
Use 10.0.0.0/8 for 10.0.0.0 - 10.255.255.255 range
Use IP addresses separated with space for scanning only the specified addresses (e.g., 10.10.10.1 10.10.10.2)
help.passwords: Path to file with list of possible passwords for connection
help.output: Save list of found IP addresses to a file
help.jobs: Number of concurrent jobs to scan network

listen.description: Listen for incoming broadcast from mining machines (including machines running factory firmware)

help.output: Save list of found IP addresses to file
help.format: Change default formatting string for device information
